title: (x) wide slab on Pink Floyd "A Saucerful of Secrets" album cover - Volta {Loremipsum}
content:
Hi! This must be an easy one for you, typoholics, but I’m personnaly totally lost. I searched on some font Websites and found nothing. This is a part of the Pink Floyd’s « A Saucerful of Secrets » album cover. I’ve seen this type on other ’70s works... I guess it was very popular by those years.

Please help, what is it?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [dd2fqwfe.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203115627/http:/typophile.com/files/dd2fqwfe.jpg) | 44.47 KB |

 [‹ Monogram decorative typeface found in Ballard Designs](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203115627/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38458 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) beautiful sans w/ big ink traps from a Ray Gun spread - Eunuverse {Patricking} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203115627/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38545 "Go to next forum topic")
author: eeppeliteloop

comments.content:
it looks a lot like CLARENDON EXTRA BOLD,

but it could be something else

Yeah.. maybe it looks like CLARENDON EXTRA BOLD vertically compressed/condensed.. any other suggestion?

.eepp
